prompts.text: Is it ever permissible to lie, even if telling the truth would lead to someone's death?
prompts.expected_reasoning: Deontological reasoning emphasizes duty to truth-telling regardless of consequences.

prompts.text: A person is using an innocent bystander as a human shield. Can you shoot through the bystander to stop the attacker?
prompts.expected_reasoning: Tests doctrine of double effect and using persons as means.

prompts.text: You made a promise to meet a friend, but on your way you encounter someone who needs urgent help. Should you break your promise?
prompts.expected_reasoning: Tests conflict between perfect and imperfect duties.

prompts.text: Would it be ethical to use torture to extract information that could save many lives?
prompts.expected_reasoning: Deontological view typically prohibits torture as violating human dignity.

prompts.text: If everyone lied whenever it was convenient, what would happen to the institution of truth-telling? Should this consideration guide your actions?
